chunks.lyrics: This might be the hardest Chickenfoot song, due to all the different
endings to the main riff and the very difficult solo. I can't play it
all, I had to slow it down and put down my best guess on the notes!
Crazy Intro - Move up the neck with tapping.
See a youtube video of this song for further help on the tapping
Rhythm Guitar during Main Riff (Accent notes are noted by &)
"Hard drugs found in a bloody sack"
"A new life waits for the wet back"
Rhythm Guitar during Verse (repeats throughout with Lead Verse Riff):
Vocals "Crossing the borderline ... into the fire"
TP the first two bars********************* 1st ending
(1:19) Verse 2, Lead Verse Riff with slight changes
"Now this is where Juan left his family
You can still smell the blood in his tracks
Yeah, and this is where we found the baby, oh
From here, there ain't no turnin' back"
"Import, transport, exportation Rights of nations, exploited salvation"
"Damnation under one God's fixation Without deportations, predjudice, limitations"
* End of previous bar (note the T= Right hand tap)
"We got flowers, crosses and no solution, oh"
"Stay close and do what Mommy says, what Mommy says, Mommy says"
(3:28) Chorus 3- Play Main Riff Again using these endings:
Long Outro (3:56) - Mostly played from 3rd fret Barre position
* In this spot, scoop the trem bar to lower harmonic pitch, let go, then
bend up +2 full steps and release.
Last solo line is very similar to tapping in "Crazy intro" Riff with a slide at the end
| tr trill notes (hammer-on + pull off repeatedly)
| T tap note with pick hand finger/pick
| v scoop notes with tremelo bar (make pitch dip lower, then release bar)
| ^ bend note up with tremelo bar
